lenders.name: anita
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed to be a blessing to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired teacher and principal and now I work for the University of Regina in Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada coordinating and teaching in a Masters of Education program.

lenders.name: Judy
lenders.loan_because: It will make the world a better place for women and children.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm an elected official for a County in the state of Oregon.

lenders.name: karsten
lenders.loan_because: I want to see how it works.
lenders.occupational_info: Currently retired. Just trying to get something going,

lenders.name: Charles
lenders.loan_because: Education, the value of work, and achieving a sense of self sufficiency puts humanity on the path to “true freedom.”

lenders.name: Pete
lenders.loan_because: Together we can make a real difference for people who otherwise might have difficulty raising money. I like the idea of loaning to a concrete individual, rather than an amorphous organisation where I have no feedback on the use to which the money is put.

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: people have helped me in the past
lenders.occupational_info: we preserve wedding flowers

lenders.name: Mike L
lenders.loan_because: I've been happy because others have believed in me.  I want my grandchildren to understand that people everywhere are the same - we all need help from time to time.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a company that builds shade structures

lenders.name: Manitoba
lenders.loan_because: I have a very good life so I want to provide an opportunity to succeed, to someone who is resourceful enough to deserve it. This is a great chance to give back to a world that has been very kind to me. I just think that this is a very good alternative to receiving gifts that we have no need for and a great conduit for giving support to those who do need.
lenders.occupational_info:
I try to work hard. 
I love to play hard
I love all 4 seasons (one of them is a bit too long). 
I kayak every chance I get.
And most of all - I just love life!!

lenders.name: Valine
lenders.loan_because: It is the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Rodger
lenders.loan_because: To believe I can help those less fortunate accomplish their goals is very rewarding to me

lenders.name: Ernie & Yvonne
lenders.loan_because: My son-in-law signed me up as a Christmas present.
lenders.occupational_info: A Probation Officer works with the Judge at Court and the Police to supervise those that are in trouble with the law and are not currently in jail.

lenders.name: Bridget
lenders.loan_because: people have helped me achieve my dreams and I want to "pay it forward" by helping other ambitious business-minded people.

lenders.name: Cole
lenders.loan_because: Christ has given me much.
lenders.occupational_info: Really fun, and a big commitment

lenders.name: Danielle
lenders.loan_because: This was a gift from someone who knew that this would be the perfect thing to give me.  This opportunity allows me to help fund a wonderful, empowering project and that puts a smile on my face!

lenders.name: Nan
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to help those who are working to help themselves, their families and their communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an environmentalist and champion of eco-friendly building.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because:
"Show me your achievement - and the knowledge will give me courage for mine."
('The Fountainhead' 1946)

lenders.name: linet Njenga
lenders.loan_because: I think it feels realy good to know that you have made a difference in someone's life with just a small contribution. When growing up, we hardly had enough money for food and clothes, my mom  worked realy hard to get me where i am today. Now that i have a little extra i can give it back to someone in need. My family was once the people im helping today, only  no one was there to lend us any money.

lenders.name: Joe, Michele & Kids
lenders.loan_because: a hand-up is better than a hand-out!

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I'd like to help out.  Good luck.
lenders.occupational_info: I provide support for attorneys.

lenders.name: paul
lenders.loan_because: I can
lenders.occupational_info: I like to make things so I often work in the building trades but for the last decade I've been working in the world of software relative to the manufacturing industry. Getting ready to change tracks again though.

lenders.name: Susan&Chuck
lenders.loan_because: We have travelled and lived around the world most of our lives and understand how lucky we are.  We're not wealthy but we are human beings and would much prefer to invest in people than in stock markets.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people to market their goods or services and play with clay on the side...;-)

lenders.name: Stöber
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of being able to turn my $25 dollars into maybe hundreds of dollar of microloans over time.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at an organic/free trade coffee shop called AMT.

lenders.name: Ginny
lenders.loan_because: we should, " Never doubt that a small, group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has."

lenders.name: Ronald
lenders.loan_because: Seeding in the dreams of others is a great reward. It is our hope to grow communities through private investments, and get the resources direct to the need.
lenders.occupational_info: Work in the banking and investment community. We have been in financial market  and communications for over 26 years,

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: I would like to make a difference in helping people improve their livelihoods.
lenders.occupational_info: I create maps and work with geographic data for a municipal government.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: This is much better than losing money in the stock market.
lenders.occupational_info: Business analyst / spreadsheet jockey

lenders.name: Joseph L. Harris
lenders.loan_because: I want to share what I have to help others help themselves and their communities.

lenders.name: C Wagner
lenders.loan_because: It's sustainable giving.

lenders.name: Carol Beth
lenders.loan_because: It is a small way to touch someone in another part of the world who needs assistance.
lenders.occupational_info: I love to paint to bring light and smiles into peoples lives.  You may not recognize any particular object in my work, but hopefully you will feel the love in my heart coming through the color, gestures and lines.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: Traditional development assistance to the Third World has been a failure, by and large.  Microfinance is a way to enable people to improve their standard of living, while taking responsibility for their actions.  I like the personal connection and the ability to see that the money I lend is making a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: Before my retirement, I was a senior manager in a management consulting firm specialized in performance management, particularly activity-based management.  Our clients were businesses and governments.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: Every time I wish someone would lend me some money because I am poor, I remember that there are people who need it more.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with lawyers to prove our cases using behavioral science.

lenders.name: Elise
lenders.loan_because: I work and have worked in countries all around the world. In doing so I have seen the most disgusting of abject poverty and the failures of the human spirit. I loan because I see kiva as one of the triumphs of the human spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: i am currently studying rural development in a masters programme, hoping eventually to work in food policy, agricultural development, fair trade networks etc.

lenders.name: Kristin
lenders.loan_because: My daughter gave me a gift certificate for Christmas. What a wonderful gift, becuase it's the gift of giving and I can pass it on to others.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to adults who speak other first languages.

lenders.name: Diana
lenders.loan_because: It connects me to heart energy.
lenders.occupational_info:
As a research assistant, my work is primarily administrative: I work in a department of the University of Kansas that is committed to improving the developmental, social and academic lives of children. 

As a yoga instructor I strive to create a supportive, nurturing enviornment  for students to practice mindfulness with the use of their breath and movement through postures.

lenders.name: Vivian
lenders.loan_because: I believe all people should be empowered to help thier families and have the basic resources to provide an education for their children

lenders.name: Debbie
lenders.loan_because: it feels great and everyone deserves opportunity!

lenders.name: Tammy
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy supporting people who give freely to enrich the lives of those that can change the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I am commited to a world where people have the freedom to choose how they live their lives.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I believe we are one human family.
lenders.occupational_info: I offer leadership in a Christian Church.

lenders.name: Henning & Hanne
lenders.occupation: Henning sells fish and Hanne is an art guide

lenders.name: Wayne
lenders.loan_because: We all can make a difference in one another's lives.

lenders.name: Luc
lenders.occupational_info: I teach French  to children in the elementary grades.  Most of my students are 8 years old.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: it makes sense to me
lenders.occupational_info: I teach teenagers to speak Spanish.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: I want to help. It is another step toward peace and equality.

lenders.name: Bob
lenders.loan_because:
I believe that small businesses are the engine that drives economies and I like the idea of being able to help people help themselves.
I am also available to provide any needed help in planning a business and putting together business plans.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am an engineer that has spent most of my career in manufacturing and operations from  setting up manufacturing facilities to running corporations. I am currently retired although I do some management consulting. 
I am an avid amateur photographer.

lenders.name: Kevin W
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Craig & Ginger
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an emergency room with 50 beds.  We see about 250-280 patients a day.

lenders.name:
David
Santa Monica
lenders.loan_because: Everyone Should

lenders.name: Mahmood (Mike)
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: David & Deborah
lenders.loan_because:
"The fact that we can't solve all the problems of the world does not absolve us of the responsibility of solving the ones we can." Bob Macauley, Founder & Chairman of Americares.
 
"How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." Anne Frank.
lenders.occupational_info: David is an accountant specializing in  reporting and compliance for not-for-profit organizations. Deborah is a medical transcriptionist.

lenders.name: Neil
lenders.loan_because: I believe in entrepreneurship.

lenders.name: Highwood
lenders.loan_because: I want to be part of the solution.

lenders.name: Chains For Change
lenders.loan_because:
As Ghandi brilliantly said, I too truly believe everyone should be the change that they wish to see in the world and Kiva has provided me and others the opportunity to do so, together, in a global effort.  The change I see is the movement away from thinking and benefiting in terms of personal gains to a more widespread outlook that focuses on building  stronger economic principals on the global level.  This could eventually better the lives of men, women, children, and even the environment, and not just in the few most lucrative areas of the world.  Expensive in the short-run? probably.  Beneficial for all in the long-run? Definitely.   

I am a global studies major and often feel overwhelmed by the things I learn, and the  desire to solve, well at least contribute to the resolve of, all of our global problems, which I have stubbornly come to realize is impossible.  So thank you, Kiva, for giving even the simplest of students the ability to begin to see and contribute to her idea of change.
lenders.occupational_info:
My mom and I make key chains in our free time and sell them.  Each key chain comes with an explanation about Kiva and the website so they can go online and check it out.  We invest the money we make from the sales to Kiva and the small businesses it helps.  We wanted to help others become involved in something we felt was making a difference and we hope that our key chains can help spread the word for many years to come.
*We are proud to announce we have earned over $275 dollars with the sale of our key chains as well as other generous donations by people who simply wanted to help!*

lenders.name: peter
lenders.loan_because: I feel I am truly helping someone directly and I like that. People who have a plan and work hard to achieve it deserve all the help the world can give them and more. Good luck to all!
lenders.occupational_info: I am extremely fortunate because I love to play music and I make a decent living at it.

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: A small commitment on my part can make a huge difference to someone else.

lenders.name: Assunta
lenders.loan_because:
I find kiva.org a wonderful way to help people overseas in a direct way - in countries where I know help is needed. 
I do it in the name of my little grand daughter Adeline

lenders.name: Karin
lenders.loan_because: I think it's important for us in the industrialized world to care for those less privilaged.  It is very inspiring to be able to help someone make a better life for themselves, and possibly fulfill their lifelong dreams!
lenders.occupational_info: I am working with sales and specilize in key accounts within Facilities Management.

lenders.name: Ken
lenders.loan_because: I think this is an awesome opportunity to make a direct difference in somone's life. I enjoy the idea that I helped someone by loaning them money for a sewing machine, or to purchase sheep -- or whatever.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm in sales for a large computer company.

lenders.name: Steven
lenders.occupational_info: Currently, I am in high school.  Shortly, I will be going to college somewhere in the United States.

lenders.name: Sandy Paquin
lenders.loan_because: I want people to have rewarding lives.
lenders.occupational_info: Logistics. I hope the people I loan to have fulfilling and happy careers,

lenders.name: Catherine
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people around the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an advertising student currently interning.

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: I feel the entrepreneurs of the world all need a little seed money.
lenders.occupational_info: My occupation is corporate finance which means I lend money to large multi-national corporations.  These companies were founded by entrepreneurs and it would be great to see someone turn a Kiva loan into a large corporation some day.

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a self employed (contractor) Internet Application developer.

lenders.name: Grace
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to be fortunate enough to help other people start or improve their business.
lenders.occupational_info: Saving Grace Designs (design jewelry)

lenders.name: Family
lenders.loan_because: We wanted to do something charitable as a family. But here is an amazing system that is helpful to those already motivated; I hope these entrepreneurs will spread the word.

lenders.name: Rishi
lenders.loan_because: I believe in free markets, entrepreneurship and the spirit of capitalism - and that everyone should be given an opportunity!
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a small technology firm helping build a business to trade securities electronically.

lenders.name: Gerald & Suzanne
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed us, and we want to bless others.

lenders.name: Donna R.
lenders.loan_because: My niece got me started.  This is such an easy way to reach across the world and give someone the help they need to make a better life for themselves.

lenders.name: Daniel & Iris
lenders.loan_because: We hope to give a chance for a proper start for different business with some capital. And we will be proud to hear from our "business partners" when they successfully manage their company.
lenders.occupational_info: We both work for a global bank in wealth management resp. human resources.

lenders.name: Bob & Lynn
lenders.loan_because: We hope our support will help others make a better life for themselves and their families.

lenders.name: one
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping those who want to help themselves.  I feel that hard-working people all around the world who might be less fortunate deserve a helping hand from those of us more fortunate.
lenders.occupational_info: I design building structures.

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people.
lenders.occupational_info: I am studying to become a teacher or doctor. I am a vegetarian and l love to read and write. This photo is me and my brother Samuel.

lenders.name: Aaron
lenders.loan_because: I'm happy to help those who are willing to help themselves - they just need money to get started.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and build software for health insurance companies.

lenders.name: Priscilla
lenders.loan_because: it makes sense.

lenders.name: Duncan
lenders.loan_because: I can. I see being born in Canada as tantamount to winning the birth lottery, and I think that with that comes a responsibility to help others in this global village that we share.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in communications - public relations, crisis communications - helping clients effectively get their messages to the people who need to hear them.

lenders.name: Cassandra
lenders.loan_because: the simplest act can change someone's life. Knowing that I can help someone somewhere around the world makes me realize how fortunate i am.

lenders.name: Carin
lenders.loan_because: I am truly impressed with an organization that finds effective means of getting funds directly from donors to entrepreneurs.  It is wonderful to be part of a global movement that both believes in changing the world for the better and finds a mechanism to do just that!
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the areas of national innovation policies and international business.  I am extremely interested in the ways in which business can adjust some of the serious inequities in the world and how wealthier nations can contribute to the well-being of people in less wealthy countries.

lenders.name: Helen Murray
lenders.occupational_info: I teach 4 year old children.

lenders.name: Leslie
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy feeling the connection to those who are trying to build a better life for themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: I have my own business, selling high fashion jewelry in direct sales

lenders.name: MATA 7
lenders.loan_because: I care
lenders.occupational_info: Great and productive

lenders.name: Samantha & Scott
lenders.loan_because: Money is like manure; it's not worth a thing unless it's spread around encouraging young things to grow.
lenders.occupational_info: We develop strategic plans to advance our company's mission and objectives and to promote revenue, profitability, and growth as an organization.  We also oversee company operations to insure production efficiency, quality, service, and cost-effective management of resources.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: I feel fortunate to be able to share with those who need help.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher of children with special needs.

lenders.name: Alana
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Kat
lenders.loan_because: I believe individuals giving to individuals is much more effective than macro loans at a government level.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage a yarn store, we sell knitting and crochet supplies to people.

lenders.name: Debra
lenders.loan_because: I am thrilled to be supporting a more sustainable world through entreprenuerial efforts.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with executives and business owners looking for innovative ways to take their business or careers to the next level.

lenders.name: C B
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Marty
lenders.loan_because: I like knowing how my loans impacts someone's life.

lenders.name: Elaine
lenders.loan_because: I think it is a really neat idea.
lenders.occupational_info: Secretarial to a Vice President of Finance in a University.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a positive difference in people's lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a therapist for underprivilidged Native American children.

lenders.name: Ken and Joyce
lenders.loan_because: The work of this organization fits with our conservative ideals...giving a hand up, not a handout.  In our view, the people at Kiva are modern-day heroes.
lenders.occupational_info:
Ken:Trucking
Joyce:Academia

lenders.name: Janet
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed with more than enough and there are far too many who do not have even the bare necessities.
lenders.occupational_info: Empowering others in life.

lenders.name: Rory
lenders.loan_because: Sad though it may seem, people are likely to allocate borrowed money 100 times more intelligently than donated money.
lenders.occupational_info: I write advertisements for things.

lenders.name: Doug and Emily
lenders.loan_because: We have both been blessed by generous people in our lives. This gives us a chance to give back to people in need.
lenders.occupational_info: College students

lenders.name: Teresa
lenders.loan_because: I think microloans are a brilliant way to support people who want to improve their lives for the better but lack the funds to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: I draw pictures or make animations to help explain medical or scientific concepts.

lenders.name: Bob
lenders.loan_because: it helps people improve their lives and become independent.
lenders.occupational_info: I design and build integrated audio and video systems.

lenders.name: Carolyn B-G
lenders.loan_because: I'd heard about microloans and thought it was a great idea, but didn't know how to do it. My sister-in-law sent us gift certificates to Kiva to get us started, and it's just snowballed from there -- I just made my 100th loan!
lenders.occupational_info: Basic cognitive psychology experiments: write computer programs, analyze data, write journal articles, conduct experiments.

lenders.name: Tracy
lenders.loan_because: to try to make a difference, a little bit at a time

lenders.name: Alasdair
lenders.loan_because: I heard about Kiva on the radio and liked what I heard.  I joined Kiva right away because it is good to help people directly.
lenders.occupational_info: I retired in 2013

lenders.name: Tyler
lenders.loan_because: it's great to be able to help someone.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student in the twelfth grade at Heritage Christian Academy in Maple Grove, MN (www.heritageweb.org).  I've been to Jinotepe, Nicaragua on a mission trip and hope to return some day.

lenders.name: Peggy
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people willing to help themselves.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: I too am a small business owner. I want to support other small businesses.
lenders.occupational_info: I make paintings of the things in the world that interest me.

lenders.name: david
lenders.loan_because: I appreciate people's efforts to improve their lives and their surroundings.
lenders.occupational_info: I write computer code for the government.

lenders.name: Jacoub
lenders.loan_because:
Giving anything is always better than nothing!
Thank you Kiva for this great idea.
lenders.occupational_info: I do write and maintain software for companies to help their business grow.

lenders.name: Felicia
lenders.loan_because: By lending I can help someone to better their lives and in return they will help someone, who will help someone.....who will help someone.....

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: my niece got me involved!

lenders.name: Patty
lenders.loan_because: Perhaps it's Catholic guilt, even though I'm not Catholic; or perhaps it's Buddhist guilt, which is more likely.
lenders.occupational_info:
Check out postcrossing.com.  It is a project where you send a postcard (a real one; not an electronic one) to a random person somewhere in the world, and then receive a postcard back from a random person somewhere in the world!

It is a wonderful way to learn about different countries, cultures, and people.

Hm, perhaps one day I will have the good fortune to receive a postcard from Mongolia, since the vast majority of my micro lending has been to that country. For some mysterious reason, I find myself strongly drawn to Mongolia. Why? Aha! Perhaps I was a Buddhist monk in one of my previous lives!

lenders.name: Ben
lenders.loan_because: its interesting.
lenders.occupational_info: I produce video for a variety of clients.

lenders.name: XIAO & Heidi
lenders.loan_because: We really would like to make a meaningful difference in someone's life. We are blessed with so much and would like to help other people have a more comfortable life.

lenders.name: Alexander
lenders.loan_because: I am very lucky.

lenders.name: Alan
lenders.loan_because: it helps people make things happen for themselves, their families, their friends, and their communities.
lenders.occupational_info: I like to help make things happen.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: I see the need & value the effort of all those working for a better life for themselves, their families and their communities because they love & care about them. Our family has been blessed with so much here, it is only right to share that with those who can benefit.
lenders.occupational_info: I strive to educate all those who visit our Aquarium or take part in the activities we sponsor for better education and understanding,of how invaluable our creatures of the seas and the oceans themselves are, as well as the significance of protecting our oceans for future generations. Life came from these seas, without them we cannot survive--anywhere.

lenders.name: Danny/josie
lenders.loan_because: because why not?

lenders.name: Kathy
lenders.loan_because: I am grateful for what I have, and I hope to make life just a little bit easier for others.

lenders.name: Tony
lenders.loan_because: It's just the right thing to do.  Living in a country where even our poorest have excess, we have an obligation to help those who don't have even the minimum.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach reading, writing, and literature to college english class students.

lenders.name: Liz
lenders.loan_because: It's my little way of changing the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for an employment agency that is part of an accounting firm.

lenders.name: Pernilla
lenders.loan_because: Why not? Everybody  can with this genious idea.
lenders.occupational_info: I´m a part time student.

lenders.name: Ann
lenders.loan_because: I am convinced that every little effort made to help others is significant, especially in the lives of those who otherwise would not have had a chance to grow and build a better future for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: As a humanitarian. One who is convinced that through dedication to hard work and education, people can acquire the skills to make changes in their own life, as well as in the lives of others in their community .

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because:
“The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.” 
-- Mahatma Gandhi
lenders.occupational_info: happy to be able to give.

lenders.name: Madeline
lenders.occupation: I enjoy doing ballet,  piano and saxophone.
lenders.loan_because: I love doing community service, especially in parts of the world other than USA. Also, I was inspired by Martin Luther King Jr. and all his efforts to make the world a better place. :)
lenders.occupational_info: I'm in middle school, so I don't have a job yet! But, I do petsit. Once I'm older, I would love to volunteer at the SPCA. My future job would be a veterinarian.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: My excess should be used to help others, to make their lives better, and to demonstrate love.  I believe helping entrepreneurs is the best way to break poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with computers to provide services and information for my employer to people all over the world.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: All people should enjoy fulfilling and happy lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am disabled and volunteer to help support my community when I am able.

lenders.name: Lorijo
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference for someone I would not normally meet
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an office building on a computer all day

lenders.name: Annica B
lenders.loan_because: It's a great idea in order to directly help people in need. And a wonderful feeling to be part of a maybe lifechanging experience in peoples lifes.

lenders.name: Charlene
lenders.loan_because: I want my children to understand the importance of believing in and supporting others in need

lenders.name: Bill
lenders.loan_because: I emigrated to Canada in 1974 and I am constantly grateful that I am living in such a wonderful country.  I am always amazed that, what seems to be, such a small amount of money can have such a positive impact on peoples' lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with a First Nations television production company.  I make real movies about real people in real situations

lenders.name: Cyndie
lenders.loan_because: It is something positive I can do to counteract negative things that happen.  At times, people I do not know help me, and making these loans is one of the ways I can give back.

lenders.name: richard
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone has a dream they should be able to fulfill.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an elementary school teacher.  I work with under privliaged children in San Francisco.  My goal is to teach to them to help others reach their goals.

lenders.name: Monica
lenders.occupational_info: I hire people for jobs helping them sustan their livelihood and families.

lenders.name: Doug & Valerie
lenders.loan_because: We want to help people achieve their dreams.

lenders.name: Ted
lenders.loan_because: I want to help working people improve their standard of living.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a National Sales Manager for a Major Appliance Manufacturer.

lenders.name: Lisanne
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Angela
lenders.loan_because: I know that women are very resourceful and they will make excellent use of the loans, benefitting themselves and their families, as well as the communities in which they live.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for the City Urban Forestry department, analyzing the tree database and making maps for the arborists.

lenders.name: Jeffery

lenders.name: Larry
lenders.loan_because: Well, actually I don't "loan" any longer. We are not loaning to persons or groups. These loans are approved and disbursed long before they are posted on Kiva. What we are really doing is relieving the local financial institution of any possible loss should their borrower fail to repay. That is not the same as loaning to a budding entrepreneur as commonly suggested by Kiva. We have become a "free" source of money to a wide variety of financial institutions, institutions that really do not need assistance. Institutions that do not discount their rates to their clients even though the money doesn't cost them anything. Servicing a loan where you have related money costs and charging 40% interest can (almost) be justified. When your money costs are zero, 40% can not be justified, that is pure profit to the institution at the expense of the client we are supposedly assisting. I choose not to participate any longer in this deception after making 179 loans here. Sorry Kiva, nice idea but lacking in truth.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a retired computer programmer.

lenders.name: Wayne
lenders.loan_because: i  believe everybody  deserves a  leg up.  i  would  not  have   received  my  education  without  student  loans

lenders.name: Leslie
lenders.occupation: city farmer, gardener; and other things
lenders.loan_because: we are all in this together
lenders.occupational_info:
I work as a gardener.  I have worked work on an organic farm and in community gardens in the city. I strongly believe in organic agricultural methods and so I tend not to loan to projects where the money is used to buy chemical fertilizers and pesticides.  Agricultural chemicals do a lot of damage to the soil and can be quite dangerous for the people using them.  There are many organic methods to improve the quality of the soil.  I think that development and sustainability must include health, ecological and environmental concerns. I want to support traditional methods that may have been lost in the process of colonization and I don't want to support the chemical and financial traps that many small farmers can fall into;  needing money to buy more chemical fertilizer because it actually depletes the soil's natural nutrients. These aren't always easy decisions to make.
I have decided to support sustainable practices, agriculturally and in other endeavours.  My first loan was to an electronics store in Nicaragua but I realized that  isn't how I want to participate,  I don't need to create more electronic refuse for the vast landfills in Central America (or anywhere else for that matter).  I lived in Central America, I have seen the landfills.
So here's to sustainable best practices and local traditional knowledge.  I am also interested in supporting artistic endeavors.  One loan I made was to support a Mayan women in Mexico who does traditional embroidery. In general the indigenous peoples are not well treated.  Having travelled in Mexico and Central America, I admire the peoples, their hard work and their desire to be respected for who they are, their history and their future.
